hints.content:
First, we need to find $5$ m on the number line.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/0fd1fadefdc4cd0b7958a4fae970084280081d64)

Each dot represents one jump rope. 

So, we need to count all of the dots on the line plot that represent lengths shorter than $5$ m.  

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/b873ae895aad331dcaecaa5b86cb9f9e5819c03f)

There are $\blueE6$ dots that represent lengths shorter than $5$ m.   

$\blueE6$ jump ropes are shorter than $5$ m.

question.content:
The lengths of jump ropes are shown below.  

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/62f8059ed67805e8f6f64ec677b1db4af44a7d56)

**How many jump ropes are shorter than $5$ meters?**  

[[â˜ƒ input-number 1]] jump ropes
